Hi Andrew, Yes, you are right as far as the subscript j goes. Even for the multi-variate case, the outer $$ x^{(i)} $$ term will always be a scalar because only the jth element of x will be picked up when we take the partial derivative for $$ \frac{\partial J}{\partial \theta_j} $$ . Regarding the question about the factor of (1/2m) in cost function, you're right that it doesn't really affect linear regression in the sense that taking it out wouldn't change the location of the cost minimum.
